title: Those Who Give Up
body:
This is just silly, I'm pretty sure there's been thousands of posts writing about the exact same thing.

Why do People give up?
I understand that if the game is looking bad u might be demoralized, but throwing in the towel over things such as team comps is ridiculous. The last few games I've had, someone or a Duo has given up and intentionally thrown the game because they don't think it is "winnable".  if we use the term "winnable" we will more or less see the result that almost all situations can be won by either side be it the enemy side is up 10k gold and 15 kills or the score is 30 - 2 that can still be won.

Is this what league is now? just people giving up based on champions and on the skill of your team members? or is this always been the case either way I don't think there's any point playing ranked in silver - gold at the current moment

(Possibly unrelated to this topic)
I don't see people giving up in battlefield/callofduty I've observed this and I see each player fighting till their last weather it be one kill or one ticket left on the clock they still battle it out till the end so why cant we in league of legends do the same?

tl;dr

Stop giving up and actually play you never know if victory is around the corner or not! {{champion:92}}

replies.body:
I definitely agree for the most part. 

I am very sick of people calling "gg ff@15" from first blood/first tower. I'm also pretty done with teammates trying to call a sneaky FF when we lose a team fight or an objective, which are actually so tiny when we look at the bigger picture and see that both teams are mostly even. 

Of course, there are always times where a surrender might actually be your best option, to save your mental. 

* You don't really want to drag out a game where everyone is flaming each other
* It can also be pretty obvious when your team stops trying, and you wont be able to make a comeback with a team thats going on autopilot mode.

>or is this always been the case either way I don't think there's any point playing ranked in silver - gold at the current moment

I hate to tell you, but it  doesn't get better the higher you go up. I find plat and low diamond some of the worst when it comes to pushing and grieving to get a surrender vote going

"Of course, there are always times where a surrender might actually be your best option, to save your mental. "

Although I do agree that there are times that you more often than not, would love to surrender I firmly believe if you cant stick out the game then you shouldn't be playing at all.

I can understand if you have had a really rough day on league but to me it isn't an excuse as you should know your limit and quit while you still are (effectively) ahead of your mental condition

But as I said I do definitely agree with you

every game has the possibility to win, but when 3 people are afk at fountain those odds get very low, to the point where it's probably not worth your time. In a 5v5, the chance to win and the lp is almost always worth the extra few minutes of your time (unless you're in korea in a netcafe).
It is a punishable offend to give up. What actions is Riot taking to punish players like this?
As far as I know there is no action taken
So any player can just refuse to group, and they can do it as long as they want. Yea seems like a pretty good game

Personally I try to never give up in ranked. Especially the way people play in bronze even if your down by a shit load of gold you can still win off of late game mistakes by the other team. 

With that said it can be difficult sometimes. When some of your teammates are behaving like idiots, sometimes I don’t want to put in another 20-30 minute in a game I think they are going to throw. For example in a normal game I played recently our tyrndamere jungle kept running down top lane by himself and trying to take towers. Sure he got kills, but he always got collapsed on and died. And since he was dead half the time we had trouble defending our base.  Now we ended up winning the game, partially because I was nasus and partially because the other team opted into a bad fight. But quite frankly winning that game was not worth the 20 minutes I spent dealing with the trynd and our tayilah who was saying some pretty derogatory things in all chat. 

So yeah sometimes people give up to early. But other times it’s justified.

I've been thinking similar thoughts for quite some time. I remember back when I first started playing I had a 70 minute game where it was 2v5 (we were the 2). I know it is a lot more difficult to that these days but still, same concept.

I agree with this, I have had a situation back when I first started in 2015 I had a similar game although u are correct in it is hard to fight 2v5, this would be now days one of the very few games I would surrender in
some people just don't want to carry those other people to a rank they don't deserve.

I cant agree with this, if the reason for giving up is  "one person doesn't deserve silver 3 I'm not gonna play"  they shouldn't be playing this game as it is a team game that requires full effort from the team.

so if 1-2 players are straight inting they deserve to be carried and you to work your ass off to get them a win while they're following you around laughing and not helping at all. no ill be ff-ing at 15.
if they don't deserve a rank, they'll fall back down, this isn't fair to the rest of the players on the team, and if you have this mindset, maybe you don't deserve that rank either.

so if theyre straight inting and making the game harder for you, you might as well carry their ass because " it's a team effort" to win that game for that jerk?. maybe you just don't see eye to eye because you're one of those players.

No I agree with nightjar and also are u in bronze elo because I haven't seen someone "straight inting" in a very long time what this post is about is those that are giving up over the small things which is more common than straight inting

is it that hard to just search someone up before assuming? no I'm S1 which is close to bronze but theres still a lot of gold players in this elo. I see people inting which then leads to people just giving up. once again if you're not seeing it you're probably doing it

you have games that look 'inty' as well in your match history, that you still won, because your team carried. 

Everyone has an off game. Maybe you suffered major packetloss or spikes in ping, maybe you were camped, maybe your jungler was feeding and that spilled over into your lane, maybe your team was slow to follow up on engages, often meaning you didn't survive. Maybe your support is a piece of... that didn't peel for you because they're autofilled and so are just going through the motions and don't really care about if they win or lose.

Your deserved rank depends on your overall performance of tens, if not hundreds of games. Overall just throwing a game is childish. In the grand scheme of things it doesn't really effect anyone's climb, it's one game out of many, but it does leave a bad aftertaste when you have some self-centred egotistical bastard who's trying to throw the game or spam ff, simply because the jungler hasn't ganked their lane, and it's now the junglers fault that they died 1v1, 3 times in the first 8min.

I've had 3 ragequitters in 22 ranked games on this account, either disconnecting, sitting at fountain or running it down mid like 3 times before sitting at fountain. Overall it isn't much, and the fact that I'm a little rusty after a near 2 month break from league, is more likely what dropped me to mid silver this season, but having a ragequitter in a winnable game leaves a very poor taste.

If your team can win multiple 4v5 teamfights without you, the game was winnable, and they probably could have won the game if you weren't such a crybaby.

not all games are winnable. every high elo player says that. 

if i have won a game that looks like ive inted its because i have farmed up to the same gold that the other team has. or my assists are high. 

if my jgler and support are rather doing nothing to help anyone in the team then they do not deserve the win. in life you don't get a free ride without losing something and guess what you don't in this game either

in low elo, throws happen, wombos are devastating and miracles can happen. In higher elo, players are better, less likely to throw, and would be better capable of closing out a game, but in low elo, so long as the nexus isn't dead, the game is very much still in the air.

Also you've had games where you've straight lost lane, but your botlane and jungle were so fed, that the toplaner you fed just got obliterated the moment he tried to fight them. They ended the game, they didn't really need you. Did you deserve to lose and go to a lower rank though? I don't actually think so, because yes they carried, but overall your performance is higher than the elo you were playing at. You might have been beaten by that enemy toplaner, but you're still overall better than other toplaners in your elo.

 In MMR systems it isn't about how you do in one game, it's about how you do in all of them.

Also life isn't fair, some people in life do get free rides, and some people have unfortunate circumstances. But at least in league, if you don't belong in a rank, over the course of many games, you always end up where you belong. So in a sense league is fairer than life, and you don't need to try to balance the scales because all you're doing is pissing off the other players on your team just because you have an issue with one guy.
Good call
